subject: How can I test a method with @Test in a method?
msgSnippet: The example code is following: @Test(expected = NullPointerException.class) public void f(){ String s = null; System.out.println(s.length()); } @Test public
messageBody:
The example code is following:
@Test(expected = NullPointerException.class)
public void f(){
String s = null;
System.out.println(s.length());
}

@Test
public void g(){
f();
}
I want to test g() only. And if f() in g() is tested ok, it's also ok in g(). If the test of f() is failed, the global test is failed too.
I want that the result based on beyond code succeed, but it is failed.What can I do if I want to accomplish that function?
Thanks a lot!
